הצצה של טלסקופ ווב לתוך חדר ילדים כוכבים מוצאת גם כוכבי לכת תינוקות https://www.sciencenews.org/article/webb-peek-stellar-nursery-baby-planetsAdam Mann Tue, 27 Aug 2024 08:00:00 +0000Planetary Science https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142988 Images by the James Webb telescope of six Jupiter-sized worlds, one of which may have a moon-forming disk, reveal clues into how planets and stars form.
האפשרויות לחומר אפל זה עתה הצטמצמו - בהרבה https://www.sciencenews.org/article/dark-matter-wimps-lzEmily Conover Mon, 26 Aug 2024 17:00:00 +0000Particle Physics https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142967 The LZ dark matter experiment has ruled out weakly interacting massive particles, or WIMPs, with a wide range of properties.
גלי המעטפת מצפים את היבשות כלפי מעלה ומכסים אותן ביהלומים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/mantle-wave-continent-plateaus-diamondsNikk Ogasa Mon, 26 Aug 2024 15:00:00 +0000Earth https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142517 A phenomenon occurring deep underground may explain how vast plateaus form far away from tectonic plate boundaries.
חום וגשם קיצוניים עוזרים לשלוח מקרי דנגי להרקיע שחקים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/extreme-heat-rain-dengue-outbreakErin Garcia de Jesús Mon, 26 Aug 2024 13:00:00 +0000Health & Medicine https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142955 As parts of the U.S. sizzle and others flood, Extreme Climate Update looks at the perfect storm this creates for mosquitoes and the diseases they carry.
הקוראים דנים באטומי 'טאווניום' היפותטיים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/readers-discuss-hypothetical-tauonium-atomsScience News Staff Sat, 24 Aug 2024 11:00:00 +0000Uncategorized https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142859 Talk of the tauonium Scientists propose a hunt for tauonium, a hypothetical variety of atom that would consist of a tau lepton and its antimatter counterpart, an antitau, Emily Conover reported in “Tauonium” (SN: 6/29/24, p. 5). Reader Hal Heaton asked why tauonium would be classified as an atom, considering it wouldn’t have typical atomic […]
טיפול בסרטן המיוחל מגיע לחולים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/long-awaited-cancer-treatmentErin Wayman Sat, 24 Aug 2024 11:00:00 +0000Uncategorized https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142805 Print and Longform Managing Editor Erin Wayman discusses the recently approved T cell therapy for cancer patients.
יותר מ-100 מיני חיידקים יכולים לפרוח בתנורי מיקרוגל https://www.sciencenews.org/article/some-bacteria-flourish-microwave-ovensAbdullahi Tsanni Fri, 23 Aug 2024 15:00:00 +0000Microbes https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142829 Swabs of 30 microwave ovens in different settings identified over 100 bacterial species, some of which could be pathogenic or cause food-borne disease.
ה-"OceanXplorers" של נשיונל ג'יאוגרפיק צולל לתוך מסתורי האוקיינוס https://www.sciencenews.org/article/national-geographic-oceanxplorers-oceanAbby Wallace Fri, 23 Aug 2024 13:00:00 +0000Oceans https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142885 National Geographic’s documentary series ‘OceanXplorers,’ produced by James Cameron, invites you aboard one of the most advanced research vessels in the world.
לפני 50 שנה, חיידקים עמידים לאנטיביוטיקה הפכו לבעיה מחוץ לבתי החולים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/50-years-ago-antibiotic-bacteriaMaria Temming Fri, 23 Aug 2024 13:00:00 +0000Health & Medicine https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142847 Infections from drug-resistant bacteria have skyrocketed over the last 50 years. Now, new technologies could help doctors save lives.
זריקות מאיץ חדשות ל-COVID-19 אושרו. מתי כדאי לקבל אחד? https://www.sciencenews.org/article/new-covid-19-vaccine-fda-approvedTina Hesman Saey Thu, 22 Aug 2024 22:23:44 +0000Health & Medicine https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142911 The vaccines target the omicron variants currently circulating in the United States.Meghan Rosen
"תרופה חיה" שאושרה לאחרונה יכולה להציל חיים נוספים של חולי סרטן https://www.sciencenews.org/article/newly-approved-drug-save-cancer-patientMeghan Rosen Thu, 22 Aug 2024 17:00:00 +0000Health & Medicine https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3142592 Tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte, or TIL, therapy is the first T cell treatment for solid tumors. It fights melanoma and maybe other cancers too.
